definition[0]: if a price or amount fluctuates, it keeps changing and becoming higher and lower
example[0]: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
example[1]: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between $20 and $40.
example[2]: The number of children in the school fluctuates around 100.
definition[1]: if prices, income, rates etc fluctuate, they change, increasing or falling often or regularly
example[3]: Dealers know that prices fluctuate and that capital losses can be expected.
example[4]: The charity’s income tends to fluctuate around £100,000
